title: Graduate/Associate Software Engineer - Build & Release Infrastructure
description:
Drive the future of collaborative open-source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open-source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
   

  

 Launchpad is a platform for managing open-source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open-source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
   

  

 Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.
   

  

 Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
   

  

**What you'll do**
* Proactively collaborate within and contribute to design, architecture, and feature-selection for solutions across distributed teams
* Write high-quality, API-first Python code with unit tests
* Debug issues and produce high-quality fixes
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 times a year for internal and external events


**Who you are**
* You love technology, working with brilliant people, and solving interesting problems
* You are a strategic thinker
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have proficiency delivering robust code to production, preferably written in Python.
* You have experience and enjoy maintaining and improving large and mature web applications.
* You have experience with databases, ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus), data management, and data modelling.
* You have an interest in, or experience with, integration, infrastructure and operations.
* You believe that robust security requires conscious efforts at every stage of delivery.
* You have familiarity with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
* You have a solid understanding of the structure of various software packaging systems, including Debian/Ubuntu packages.


**Location**
 This is a remote role based in the EMEA region. Candidates will be expected to be located within this region.
   

  

*Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply, and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.*
 #stack

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
description:
**About the role** 




 In this role, you’ll be an integral part of our mission to deliver high-quality software products. Working in a collaborative, agile environment, you’ll design, develop, and execute automated tests that ensure our products meet the highest standards. Your work will directly contribute to creating a culture of continuous improvement and excellence, helping us push boundaries in the property management technology space.
 



  





**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include** 



* Designing and developing automated test frameworks and scripts to ensure robust software quality.
* Implementing performance and load testing strategies to validate application scalability.
* Integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines and monitoring their performance.
* Collaborating with developers to identify test coverage needs and troubleshoot issues.
* Analyzing test results to provide insights into product readiness and quality.
* Leading cross-team quality initiatives and mentoring team members in test automation best practices.



  





**Who You Are** 




 You are a proactive problem solver with a passion for quality and innovation. With a detail-oriented mindset and a collaborative approach, you thrive in an agile, fast-paced environment where teamwork is key. You take pride in delivering excellent results and are eager to drive quality at every stage of development. Your strong communication skills enable you to work effectively with diverse teams, and your ability to adapt and learn ensures you stay ahead in the field. You are fluent in Swedish and English.
 



  





**Experience** 



* At least 5 years of experience in test automation or non-functional testing.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, or JavaScript.
* Hands-on experience with test automation tools (e.g., Playwright, Cypress, Appium).
* A solid understanding of performance testing, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud platforms like AWS or Azure.
* Familiarity with Linux/Unix, shell scripting, and DevOps practices.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Remote friendly - you'll be part of a team that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.



  





**Location** 




 This role offers a hybrid work setup, blending the flexibility of remote work with access to collaborative office spaces. Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.
 



  





**Excited?** 




 Join Odevo’s journey toward excellence! If this sounds like your next career move, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Back End Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Backend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





 We are looking for multiple profiles, both fluent in Swedish, and non-Swedish speaking.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Backend Developer** 




 Your role as a Backend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



 In addition, you will:
 


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and mantain innovative solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Work with modern development practices, including CI/CD, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and automated testing
* Help maintain system documentation and participate in project reviews
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of backend-end development. As a person, you are flexible and adaptable to changes, and can see yourself thriving in working in a highly innovative fast-paced start-up like environment.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, backend engineering
* At least 5 years of professional experience in backend development, ideally in an agile project environment
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* Solid knowledge of both Java and .NET
* Experience working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Ideally, you are comfortable working with containerized solutions (Kubernetes, Docker)
* Any experience or interest to work with Kotlin will be considered as a plus but is not required for this role
* Experience working in agile working environment with tools like Jira and Confluence



  





**What you can expect from us** 




 Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop.
 



  





**Join Valtech** 




 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
 



  





**Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey? And would you like to become our next Backend Developer?** 




  





**Then apply today** 
 . We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**⭐ Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.**
**Flexible & autonomous teams, built upon trust.**
 Together, we decide how to win. We trust and respect the individual and have a great engineering culture. Our teams consistently score high in motivation and engagement measurements. We believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside of the team.
   

  

**New challenges and personal growth.**
 We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions.
   

  

**A passionate and fun culture.**
 We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on including hackathons, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
   

  

**A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm.**
 Our finances are in excellent shape, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product.
   

  

**Constantly evolving tech and modern tooling.**
 We are constantly looking to improve our product and tech. Do you have ideas how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!
   

  

**🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?**
**Role**
 Now, we are looking for an Engineering Manager who will inspire, lead, and grow one of our software engineering team consisting of 5-8 members. You will lead your team in their daily work and have staff responsibility while staying in touch with technology to provide technical leadership. You will lead and coach your agile team, taking end-to-end responsibility for the quality and well-being of our services, both when building new features and in production, and report directly to our CTO. In the role of an Engineering Manager, you will:
   

  

* Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
* Play a key role in helping us continue attracting, developing, and retaining great engineering talent
* Drive continuous improvement focusing on quality in your team and across teams
* Prioritize and optimize for the highest speed in execution while maintaining good quality
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices
* Work closely with other engineering managers and development teams to create great software


**So, what are we looking for?**
* >5 years of experience in managing successful team deliveries in roles like product owner/manager, scrum master, or tech lead
* Strong leadership and communication skills and experience in fostering a collaborative engineering culture, with a people-first approach
* Ability to inspire, coach, and mentor team members to help them reach their full potential
* Passion for agile software development practices and modern engineering methodologies, bonus if you have experience as a developer!
* Fluent in English and Swedish and eligible to work in Sweden full-time without restriction
* A bachelor's or master's degree in engineering, project management or a related field


**Why join us? 🤔**
 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of passion, collaboration, and challenge. As an Engineering Manager, you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. You’ll also get to enjoy our fun and engaging culture with activities like padel tournaments, webinars, Friday beers, and Level-up Hackathons.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about leadership, agile practices, and building a strong team culture while staying connected to technology, we want you on the team!

title: Morot & Co söker en fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Morot & Co, ägt av nordiska Mediafy Relations AB och en del av Bonnierkoncernen, erbjuder företag lösningar för att skapa motiverande och träffsäkra belöningar för att stärka relationer till deras personal och kunder.
 



  





 Vi är Mediafygruppens strategiska tillväxtområde och vi är sedan lanseringen 2019 på en rejäl och spännande tillväxtresa. Vi söker nu en engagerad fullstack-utvecklare som vill bidra till vår tekniska utveckling och framgång!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Fullstack-utvecklare hos oss ingår du i ett lösningsorienterat team med stark laganda. Rollen är varierad och låter dig arbeta med både förvaltning och förbättringsprojekt till större helhetslösningar inom API-utveckling och e-handel. 
 



  





 Vi värdesätter nära samarbete både med kollegor på distans och på plats, samt en god affärsförståelse för att kunna skapa effektiva och välanpassade lösningar. Du kommer att bidra i tekniska diskussioner och ges möjlighet att påverka vårt arbetssätt och kvaliteten i vår kod.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som fullstack utvecklare med fokus på PHP (gärna med Laravel) och Next.js.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i TypeScript och JavaScript samt API-design och utveckling, helst inom RestAPI.
* God vana av databashantering i MySQL och erfarenhet av CI/CD med GitHub Actions.
* Ett stort plus är erfarenhet av headless arkitektur, e-handel, Sanity (headless CMS), Magento, och Azure Cloud-tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av tillgänglighetsanpassad webbdesign är meriterande.



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 



* Designa, utveckla och underhålla både frontend och backend-lösningar med Laravel och Next.js.
* Skapa och optimera API-lösningar (RestAPI) för hög prestanda och skalbarhet.
* Delta i planering och implementation av nya funktioner och systemarkitektur.
* Identifiera och lösa tekniska problem i en snabb och föränderlig miljö.
* Samarbeta med teamet för att säkerställa bästa praxis inom utveckling, inklusive kodstandarder och dokumentation. Tillsammans skapar vi en kultur där hållbarhet och noggrannhet i kodbasen prioriteras genom tydlig kommunikation och tekniskt ledarskap.



  





**Egenskaper vi värdesätter** 




 Vi värdesätter personer med ett skarpt öga för detaljer och en strävan efter hög standard samt förmåga att lösa problem på ett strukturerat sätt. Du är initiativrik och ansvarstagande, med en samarbetsinriktad inställning och vilja att dela tankar och idéer med Morot & Co's olika team. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en agil miljö är en fördel och du uppskattar både tempot och variationen det innebär.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Vi har förkortad arbetstid som förmån, och heltid motsvarar 37,5 arbetstimmar/vecka. Du kommer att arbeta från vårt nyrenoverade kontor i A-House på Östermalmsgatan. Vi har en hybrid arbetsplats vilket ger möjlighet till både flexibilitet och teamwork. 
 



  





 Vi värnar om våra medarbetares välmående, både på kort och lång sikt. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheten att avsätta 2 h/vecka för träning och motion under betald arbetstid, samt tillgång till högst möjliga friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom omfattas du av tjänstepension.
 



  





 Tillsammans strävar vi efter att skapa en positiv och kreativ arbetsmiljö där glädje, nyfikenhet och gemenskap står i fokus. Hos oss finns det högt i tak och en stark lagkänsla.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 



* Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra från dig och att få möjligheten att välkomna dig till Morot & Co. Ansök idag och ta det första steget mot en spännande framtid tillsammans med oss!

title: Senior Backend Engineer
company_industry: Financial Services, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting and equally as important; access to financing and funding, in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform
 



 Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you’re excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.
 



  





**What you’ll do at Gilion** 




 As a senior backend engineer at Gilion, you will be part of a cross functional product team working alongside other developers, designers and machine learning specialists. The tech team iterates fast, and being data nerds, we measure user behavior and verify our bets through user testing. We balance rapid iteration experiments with long-term strategic bets and continuous improvements to our infrastructure. In this role you will also:
 


* contribute to architectural decisions as part of a functional team working across the product teams.
* work hands on in developing micro services in Go or Python on our infrastructure built with Kubernetes, Docker, Github and GCP.
* experiment with new technologies, especially utilizing the latest machine learning applications, both to improve developer experience but also our products.
* take part in a low overhead, product development process where ideas go to production in days and deployments to production happen multiple times a day.



  





**About you:** 



* 5+ years of working as a software engineer with a backend focus
* experience of working in a cross functional team
* openness to learn and thrive in tackling a variety of problems that you might not have seen before.
* collaborative mindset where you leverage your colleagues expertise for coming up with a better solution together.
* leadership mindset or experience from leading initiatives or teams



  





*While it’s not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:* 



* a DevOps mindset and understanding of infrastructure and tooling
* experience with security, architecture and/or cloud technologies



  





**What we offer:** 



* work-life balance, hybrid-remote model and attractive compensation package
* diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
* experienced founders, backed by top investors
* a growth journey with tons of development opportunities and technical challenges
* globally scalable fintech product within machine learning



  





 At Gilion, we’re all about Growth. We believe in hiring great people with the right values and giving them a platform to grow with. Our unique combination of startup mentality, experienced team and ambitious vision make room for endless possibilities.
 



 Does this sound interesting? We look forward to your application!

title: Test developer in electrification
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a test engineer at Scania, you will develop a broad competence within the vehicle's control system and understand how different functions work together in the software. You will have the opportunity to use your creativity and innovative ideas to find effective ways to verify the product and improve our methods. Our group specifically works with software that controls charging, climatization, and auxiliaries in the vehicle, as well as testing the cyber security of the software.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 Your tasks will include system testing of software, including requirements review, analysing test results, test case creation, and the creation of test scripts for automated tests. Testing will be performed both in test rigs (SIL and HIL) and in real vehicles (trucks and buses). Historically, we have worked on HIL rigs built and maintained by the group (Vector rigs), but we are also transitioning to new test script languages and dSpace rigs for newer projects.
   

  

 Close collaboration with software developers and requirement writers is a natural part of your role to deliver high-quality products to our customers.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You can fit into the team with a few years of experience in a similar role or with experience in a related field such as software development. We learn together and have a journey towards ISO26262 certification ahead of us. You are responsible, structured, meticulous, and communicative. You enjoy participating in discussions and making decisions with the team. You can solve complex problems and enjoy challenging yourself and your colleagues to find creative solutions. Flexibility is key, and you are ready to change focus when needed.
   

  

 To be qualified for this job you should have:
   

  

  

* A degree in electrical engineering, embedded systems, mechatronics, or similar.
* Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, Capl, and/or C.
* Experience with Git or similar version control systems.
* Understanding of embedded systems and basic electrical engineering.
* A European driving license for a car.
* Proficiency in English, both spoken and written.
* Swedish is beneficial but not required. However, we would like you to consider obtaining a truck driver's license in the future, which currently requires a theory test in Swedish.


 Meritorious
   

  

  

* C and/or D driving license.
* Previous experience with Scania, automotive, or testing.
* Familiarity with Vector-based programs such as CANoe and vTESTstudio.


 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 In our team, we work closely together in an inclusive and creative environment. We support each other daily, with the flexibility to work from home or the office as needed. Currently, we are on-site 50% of the time, following company guidelines. Our team is diverse in gender, age, and nationality, and our working language is English.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-26. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Malin Petersén, recruiting manager and Assignment Manager at malin.petersen@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Microsoft Dynamics Consultant
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Developer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 We are looking for a Developer with a minimum of 5 years of experience in digital product development. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen and a strategic mindset, coupled with a self-leadership attitude and a "can-do mentality." You will be responsible for presenting initiatives and driving potential business value from inception to completion.
 



  





**Experience:** 




 6-8 years of professional experience
 



  





**Essential Skills:** 




**Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce:** 



* Comprehensive knowledge of the D365 Commerce module and its standard APIs
* Integration expertise with D365 Finance and Supply Chain Dynamics (SCD)



**Development Skills:** 



* POS changes: GUI development using
 **TypeScript**
* CSU changes: Development using
 **C#**
* HQ changes: FO development using
 **X++**



**Development Operations:** 



* Setting up development pipelines
* Deployment processes and release handling using
 **Azure DevOps** 
 ,
 **GitHub** 
 , and
 **Jira**



**Microsoft Power Platform Expertise:** 



* Strong proficiency in
 **Power Apps** 
 ,
 **Power Automate** 
 , and
 **Power BI**



**API Integrations and Asynchronous Requests:** 



* Experience with tools such as
 **Axios**



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Experience with
 **Bootstrap**
* Retail project experience
* Fluent in English with excellent communication skills
* Strong understanding of writing unit tests using frameworks like
 **Jest**
* Familiarity with browser testing, debugging, and tools like
 **BrowserStack** 
 and
 **LambdaTest**
* Ability to plan, design, build, and review reliable, scalable, and accessible websites



  





**Competencies:** 



* Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce
* Strong expertise in Microsoft Power Platform



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Drive the end-to-end process of presenting, developing, and delivering initiatives that provide measurable business value
* Develop and customize D365 Commerce modules to meet business needs
* Build robust development pipelines, ensuring smooth deployment and release processes
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration with D365 Finance and SCD
* Support the development and maintenance of reliable, scalable, and accessible websites

title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer for Aboard
description:
After bringing the Teamtailor ATS to 10,000 customers worldwide we are now ramping up our next big journey with our second product: Aboard!
   

  

 At Teamtailor we’ve always been focused on enabling a great candidate experience, by building software that is personal, different, and kind. We want to help our customers extend that same care when candidates become employees. That’s where Aboard comes in, taking over when a candidate has been hired and enabling seamless onboarding and employee experience.
   

  

 Aboard is still an early-stage product, built in Ruby on Rails by a small, experienced team of three developers and one designer. Now we’re looking for one more developer to help shape our next big product and how we build it.
   

  

 We are looking for…
   

  

* An experienced full stack developer with very strong Ruby on Rails skills. Experience with Stimulus.js and Tailwind CSS is also a big plus.
* A Product-Minded Software Engineer with experience working in fast-moving startups.
* A self-motivated “manager of one” who enjoys being in the driver’s seat and seeing the impact of their work directly. A real Doer.


 This is a hybrid remote role. We are only looking for candidates in Stockholm or Linköping, Sweden who enjoy working closely together with their colleagues from our great offices a few days per week.
   

  

 You will get…
   

  

* The joy of joining a small team in an early-stage product where your work has a huge impact! Working closely together with our early customers, and our sales and customer success teams, we are iterating fast to make sure we’re building a product that solves our customers needs and puts a smile on their faces.
* The perks of an established company with a working business model, such as job security, occupational pension, etc.

title: Frontend-utvecklare (iOS)
