title: Product Security Engineer, R&D
description:
*Are you interested in product security and "capturing flags"? Do you like to work in Linux? Join us as a Product Security Engineer in our software solutions team!*


Westermo is known for our robust data communication products. To us, quality is everything and we are proud to be creating our market leading products – both hardware and software – on our own. At Westermo, we have developed our own Linux based Operating System with quality and robustness in mind for our network products; WeOS. As our commitment on security is growing, we are ISO27001 & IEC 62443-4-1 certified, and as part of this commitment, we are now looking for a Product Security Engineer in R&D to handle the next level of customer expectations within this fast-moving area.

**Are you our new Product Security Engineer?**


At Westermo we develop software for our hardware products – routers and switches – with tough system resource constraints. As Product Security Engineer of our networking products, you will be working with hands-on-security in all parts of the Westermo SDLC (Secure Development Lifecycle) domain, such as threat, risk, and vulnerability management, including assisting developers with requirements, design and threat modeling. Within vulnerability management, you will be lead member of our PSIRT (Product Security Incident Response Team), including handling vulnerabilities from intake to disclosure.  

  

You will work closely with software developers, CSPO (Cyber Security Product Owner), testers and stakeholders. At Westermo there is always room for initiative and creativity. In addition to the defined role, we look forward to you contributing with ideas of improvements to our processes, guidelines and tools. If you like to try ideas, develop new solutions, solve problems and develop for the future - then Westermo is the place for you to grow!

**So, who are we looking for?**


We are looking for someone who is eager to work with security in everything that concerns our products. For this role, you need to have knowledge within security related product development in the Linux and Embedded Systems domain. You have a deep understanding of how different hardware architecture affects the software from a security perspective. You may have previous experience as a Pen-Tester, as a member in PSIRT or as a security architect/designer/programmer. You are consistent and punctual in writing to meet our high standards in disclosing vulnerabilities. Besides your interest in the area, you also have some experience, for instance in taking courses or written a thesis work or are into "Capture The Flag" competitions.

**Requirements:**

* Experience from working in product development SDLC
* Experience as Pen-Tester or PSIRT analyst, security architect/designer/programmer/developer or similar.
* Experience in Embedded Systems.
* Skilled Linux-user.
* Experience in C-programming.
* Fluent in English, and at least moderate in Swedish, spoken and written.
* Leadership experience is meritorious


Oh, and don't worry, if you’re not an expert in all the things described – you'll learn

**In return, we offer:** You will be working at the forefront of technology in a friendly, open culture where we you get the opportunity to learn from skilled colleagues every day. A mature and caring leadership in a flat organization. Through our collective bargain agreement you will be covered in terms of insurance, pension and other benefits. We like to have fun together and we regularly enjoy sports and other social activities as a team. We believe that magic happens when people meet. We are a learning organization and we truly love to try new things, think outside the box and be innovative together!

**Basic information:**

* Location: Kopparlunden, Västerås
* Job type: Full time
* Employment contract: Permanent


Don’t miss out on this opportunity – apply today. For further information please contact:


Manager Fredrik Linder at fredrik.linder@westermo.com Elin Sandell, Recruiter at elin.sandell@westermo.com


Robust industrial data communications - Made easy

*Welcome to a rapidly growing international company, thriving at the forefront of cutting edge technology. Westermo develops and manufactures advanced devices for industrial data communication, used in mission critical installations and harsh industrial environments. The very robust and secure communication networks built with our products provide a high value for our customers.*

*We are passionate about taking advantage of the growth opportunities in our market. The work environment is very dynamic with great loyalty and team spirit. It is expected to take initiative and our flat organization creates efficiency and provides the opportunity for those who are closest to the task of solving it.*


Westermo is a leading supplier of Industrial Data Communications equipment to the World market. Sales are conducted through our own offices in key markets in Europe, North America, Australia and Asia, as well as through distributors and OEM customers worldwide. Development and manufacturing take place in Sweden, Ireland and Switzerland. Westermo was founded in 1975 and has today more than 300 employees with a turnover around 800 MSEK. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Beijer Electronics AB, listed on the stock exchange.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
***Vill du jobba på ett företag som utvecklar teknologi i framkant och samtidigt bidra till en hållbar framtid? På Inmotion kan du få allt detta och dessutom arbeta tillsammans med engagerade och kunniga kollegor som gärna delar kunskap och glädje dagligen.***




  





***I samband med att vi växer söker vi nu en Mjukvaruutvecklare.***




  





***Sök tjänsten idag och bli en del av oss och vår tillväxtresa!***




  





  





**Arbetsbeskrivning:** 




 I din roll som Mjukvaruutvecklare är du en nyckelspelare i utvecklingsprocessen och arbetar med hela kedjan från att designa, utveckla samt testa våra kravställda mjukvarufunktioner.
 







 Övriga arbetsuppgifter:
 



 Kvalitetssäkra andras arbete genom granskning och testning
 



 Rapportera avvikelser
 



 Utveckla och underhålla satta processer
 



 Dokumentation av eget arbete
 



 Kundkontakt
 



  





**Kvalifikationer och personliga egenskaper:** 




 Vi söker dig som har minst en 3 årig relevant högskoleutbildning och tidigare erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling. Du är van att jobba i team och har erfarenhet från hårdvarunära programmering (embedded) C programmering, python, test på Unit, integration, krav- och testskrivning. Flytande engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav.
 



  





 Vidare ser vi att du jobbat med något av följande verktyg:
 



 C unit
 



 robot framework
 



 jira
 



 subversion
 



  





 Som person är du tekniskt intresserad med en analytisk förmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad, prestigelös och samarbetsvillig. Då arbetet innefattar en del kundkontakt är det även viktigt att du har en god kommunikationsförmåga och lätt för att skapa goda relationer.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig:** 




 En familjär arbetsplats med hög kompetens och trevliga kollegor med höga ambitioner. Vi är en global koncern och det finns stora möjligheter till professionell utveckling för rätt person.
 



 Utöver det erbjuder vi bland annat:
 


1. Kompetensutveckling
2. Kollektivavtal
3. Friskvårdsbidrag
4. Hälsoundersökning
5. Ett väletablerat och stabilt företag



  





**Om oss:** 




 Vi är en världsledande leverantör av elektriska drivsystem och komponenter som hjälper våra OEM-kunder inom fordonsindustrin att elektrifiera t.ex. bussar, lastbilar, entreprenadmaskiner och gaffeltruckar. Inmotion Technologies har utveckling och tillverkning av kraftelektronik i vår anläggning i Tyresö, söder om Stockholm. Inmotion tillhör Zapi Group med huvudkontor i Italien och med utveckling och tillverkning av produkter i Sverige, USA, Kanada och Kina.
 



  





**Övrigt:** 




**Vår rekryteringsprocess:** 
 Onlineintervju följt av intervju/er på plats hos Inmotion. Vi använder oss även av logik- och personlighetstester.
 



**Start:** 
 Omgående, med hänsyn till eventuell uppsägningstid
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid, tillsvidareanställd
 



  





 Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan direkt om du är intresserad av tjänsten till jobs@evs-inmotion.com.
 



 Har du frågor kan du kontakta Karin Berg Johansson HR Chef 08-682 65 41.
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Data Engineer/Scientist
description:
**DATA ENGINEER/SCIENTIST** 




 Är du redo att ta steget? Att utvecklas till nästa nivå! Vi är entreprenörer som har en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du kan utvecklas både personligt och professionellt. Kom med på vår resa och hjälp ambitiösa företag att nå sin fulla potential med teknik, data och AI i rollen som Data Engineer/Scientist. Vi söker dig som har lite erfarenhet redan, eller mycket.
 



  





**Itera Sverige** 




 Itera är en ca. 800 man stark Skandinavisk IT-konsultkoncern. Nyligen startade vi upp vår verksamhet i Stockholm och vi växer stadigt. Samtidigt som vi har en långsiktig och stabil koncern i ryggen är vi på många sätt en start-up i Stockholm och teamet är tight. Vi har fokus på branscherna Energi och Försäkring/Finans, men även andra branscher "bubblar" så som Försvar. Hos oss finner du en inkluderande arbetsmiljö, där mångfald är viktigt och nyfikenhet står i fokus. Vi brinner för att leverera hållbara resultat och göra verklig skillnad med allt vi gör. Ambitionerna är stora för både koncernen och för vår svenska verksamhet. Därför söker vi nu nyfikna teknikentusiaster som vill vara med och forma vår framtid.
 



  





**Om teamet – personerna du ska arbeta med** 




 Kollegorna på Stockholmskontoret är alla erfarna konsulter. En del jobbar övergripande som affärsarkitekter eller projektledare medan andra har djup teknisk kompetens inom Data Engineering och Data Science. Data, AI och analys/insikt är ett strategiskt område för hela Itera, och vi har arbetat inom detta område i över 15 år. Vår miljö består av drygt 30 konsulter i Skandinavien och vi både jobbar och umgås tvärs alla länder. Itera har lång erfarenhet av att hjälpa företag att skapa värde från data och söker alltid både de tekniska och organisatoriska lösningar som krävs för att lyckas med datadrivna initiativ och investeringar.
 



  





 Vi letar nu efter fler passionerade teknikentusiaster som vill vara med och forma framtiden för oss och våra kunder. Hos oss hittar du en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö, där mångfald och nyfikenhet står i fokus.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden – vad kommer du jobba med?** 



* Affärsanalys och lösningsdesign: Analysera affärsprocesser och översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar, samt föreslå förbättringar och framtida möjligheter
* Dataintegration: Designa, bygga, testa och producera moderna och robusta datapipelines, avancerade ETL-processer, dataströmmar, API:er och visualiseringar
* Dataanalys och tillgängliggörande: Hjälpa kunder och kollegor ge råd och implementera verktyg för att tillgängliggöra data och analysera
* Dataarkitektur: Beskriva arkitekturer, datalager och databaser som stöder dataåtkomst och avancerad analys, och implementera dem genom moderna visualiseringsverktyg
* Utveckla bästa praxis: Bidra till att definiera standarder och bästa praxis för moderna BI- och AI-lösningar
* Hjälpa Iteras kunder inom drift, förvaltning och vidareutveckling av deras dataplattformar



  





**Önskade kvalifikationer** 



* Relevant utbildning, gärna på masternivå (relevant erfarenhet räknas också)
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att leverera i dataprojekt
* Eftersom vi främst arbetar i Azure är det önskvärt att du är bekant med plattformen
* Erfarenhet av / kunskap om Databricks och/eller MS Fabric
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift, samt goda kunskaper i engelska



  





**Det är en fördel om du har följande** 



* Duktig på att kommunicera, har ett kommersiellt tänk och erfarenhet som konsult
* Motivation att ständigt förnya din tekniska kompetens, då branschen är i ständig utveckling
* Kunskap om tjänster från andra molnleverantörer än Azure t.ex. (AWS, GCP)
* Erfarenhet från branscher som Energi, Finans eller Försvarsindustri
* Erfarenhet från ett eller flera av följande områden:
* Databehandling (data wrangling, datakvalitetskontroll) för både strukturerad data som tidsserier och ostrukturerad data
* Data pipeline design och orkestrering för streaming-data och batch-data
* Datamodellering och styrning
* Uppsättning av molnbaserad dataplattform
* Datarapporterings- och/eller analysprojekt
* Skapa teknisk lösningsarkitektur.



  





**Vad vi på Itera kan erbjuda dig** 




 Itera Sverige kan bäst beskrivas som en start-up. Du kommer in i en spännande tillväxtfas där du kan påverka företaget mycket om du vill. Samtidigt tillhör vi en trygg koncern som funnits i 30 år. Vi är knappt 800 teknikexperter, designers, problemlösare, projektledare och organisationsutvecklare som varje dag arbetar för att göra skillnad. Vi är solida och börsnoterade på Oslo-börsen men präglas ändå starkt av entreprenörskap, stora ambitioner och bra möjligheter att nå dem. De senaste fem åren har vi röstats fram i Norge som ett av de mest innovativa företagen, oavsett bransch.
 



  





 Vi har konkurrenskraftiga villkor med bra försäkringar och pensionsplaner. Vi har både aktieprogram och bonussystem för de anställda.
 



  





 Om du är som oss och gillar att göra skillnad, gillar att engagera dig, är mån om ständigt lärande och att dela kunskap samt tycker att en start-up verkar spännande, då hoppas vi att du bjuder in dig själv till en informell pratstund med oss.
 



  





 Skicka ditt CV och en kort ansökan till oss och följ med på vårt äventyr!

title: Senior IT Tester
description:
* Company: BluEdge
* Max Price rate (SEK/h): Openbid
* Location: Stockholm (SE)
* Start date: 20 Jan 2025
* End date (renewable): 30 Jun 2025


**Detailed description of work task to be carried out:**

* Develop test scenarios with good measure of test coverage and identity test data for the corresponding test scenarios

**Requirements**

* Expertise in Functional testing in Database and Data migration, transformations and ETL.
* Expertise and sound knowledge in Advanced SQLs and Joins
* Experience in Slowly Changing Dimensions Data Warehousing concepts
* Good analytical skills with ability to understand the data lineage of the system under test.
* Hands-on experience in Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, Data Stage

title: Staff Engineer
description:
This is a general track for Staff Engineer or above in any team at Canonical. After the first round of interviews we will establish which teams might be an excellent fit, and progress your application with them.
   

  

 Canonical delivers open source to the world across every class of compute. Canonical Ubuntu is the world's favourite Linux for cloud, desktop and IoT. Our engineering teams work on operating systems, programming languages, applications, devices, infrastructure and services. We work in Golang, Python, C, C++, and Rust for system services, and use React and Flutter on the front end.
   

  

 In our levelling framework, a Staff Engineer is not only an outstanding software architect and coder, they also demonstrate the leadership qualities needed to work across teams and products, enabling others to create outstanding technologies and communities. A Staff Engineer partners with an Engineering Director, who is also code-capable, and together they take responsibility for product outcomes. We hire based on academic results and proven product execution, and we select those with a passion for open-source software, innovation, and cutting-edge technology. In this role, you will make a significant contribution in Canonical's portfolio through high-quality code, technical leadership, team motivation and direction, exceptional design, and crisp documentation.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer you'll drive the architecture, design and evolution of high-impact open source. Our teams work at every level of the stack. From the kernel and system software at the core of Ubuntu through to major language runtimes and the bleeding-edge of cloud automation and distributed systems, you'll have the opportunity to work on complex but highly rewarding projects. Our teams also build the services which deliver Ubuntu to the world, on cloud, devices, servers and PCs.
   

  

 Additionally, this role will give you the opportunity to engage with the broader open-source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and ensure seamless software operations at scale.
   

  

 Location: we have remote opportunities for Staff Engineers in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead design and architecture of an impactful open source project
* Code in Golang, Rust, Python, C/C++ or Typescript / React
* Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
* Mentor, develop and advise colleagues in their career progression
* Display technical leadership in Canonical and our communities
* Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation with the aim to make it the best of its kind
* Work from home with global travel twice annually for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Technical leadership as well as team motivation, direction and pace
* Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Deep experience with at least one of Go, Rust, Python or C
* Subject matter expertise in your engineering domain
* Conscientiousness and detail orientation, with a focus on performance
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with container technologies such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience with highly concurrent, distributed systems
* Experience with embedded systems
* Performance engineering – from kernel to web – benchmarks, optimisation
* Experience with software security – fuzzing, tabletop threat models, analysis, audit
* Experience build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services
* Deep quality and test engineering
* Web or Flutter front-end experience
* REST and gRPC API experience
* SQL and NoSQL data store expertise
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit globally and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Customer Engineer, Cloud Security
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience in in selling security consulting services in the capacity of a technical business engineer in a cloud computing environment, or equivalent experience in a similar customer-facing role (e.g., within a professional services, solutions architect, or systems engineering team).
* Experience in cyber-security technical solutions: SIEM/SOAR (EDR, XDR), Threat Intelligence (threat detection, malware intelligence, attack surface management), Cloud Security (CSPM, CWPP, CNAPP, or identity and access management systems).


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Certification in the Cloud or Security industry.
* Experience in either of these market sectors: retail, healthcare, energy or chemicals.
* Knowledge of product and solution market trends in the cyber-security industry (e.g., ransomware, attack frameworks, zero trust, etc.).
* Ability to speak publicly and deliver technical presentations.
* Ability to travel up to 50% of the time as needed.


**About the job** 
 The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work with Security, Business and Google Cloud teams to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand customer technical and compliance objections, and develop strategies to resolve technical blockers.
* Work with all Google Cloud Security products to demonstrate and validate solution benefits in customer and partner environments.
* Support Google Cloud Security opportunities and relationships, own technical aspects of solutions, deliver technical presentations, product and solution briefings, proofs-of-concepts and demos to customers, partners, and stakeholders.
* Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google's solutions value proposition using techniques including presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management, and response documents.
* Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events where applicable.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Test Engineer(Swedish Speaking)
description:

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

title: Senior Material Modeling Engineer
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Senior Material Modeling Engineer.**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Senior Material Modeling Engineer, you will be engaged in the development and implementation of material models, ensuring they are ready for daily use by our engineering team. You will collaborate closely with our colleagues in the materials laboratory. Our team engages in a variety of tasks, including FEM analysis, alloy development, constitutive modeling, methodology development, and providing support to workshops, procurement, and service. Our responsibilities lie within the turbine module systems and components in the gas turbine. This role offers the flexibility to work remotely, with the expectation of regular in-office presence to ensure effective collaboration and team integration.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and implement constitutive and life material models for high-temperature applications
* Contribute to methodology and procedure development for constitutive and life material modeling
* Support development and technology projects by assessing, planning, and evaluating material testing


**Requirements**
* Background in solid mechanics, material science, or a related field
* Experience in material modeling
* Experience with FEM analysis for lifing calculation
* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* A collaborative mindset and strong communication skills
* Experience with UMAT is an advantage


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!

 **sandhya@vipas.se**
 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
